        • pycheron.metrics.deadChanMeanMetric

    pycheron.metrics.deadChanMeanMetric¶

    deadChanMean(st, win_size=None, threshold=0.05, generateMasks=False, masksByTime=True, database=None)[source]¶

    Function uses a simplistic rolling mean, using win_size and increments over the trace object by that win_size. Unlike a typical rolling mean, no samples are shared between windows, e.g.

    [———–][———–][———–][———–][———–][———–][———–][———–]

    Parameters:
    • st (obspy.core.stream.Stream) –
      • obspy stream object
    • win_size (int) – number of samples to use for windowing. When None, determines the number of samples to use based on the sample rate
    • threshold (int) – threshold to trigger deadChan for within rolling window. Recommended to keep this default value for triggered a dead channel
    • generateMasks (bool) – Generate boolean qc mask array.
    • masksByTime (bool) – Generate a time-based qc mask list.
    • database (pycheron.db.sqllite_db.Database) – database object
    Returns:

    Returns list of dictionaries that includes the following keys and type for each trace within the stream:

    • dead_channel_times (list) - Lists of dicts with dead channel start/endtime
    • end_time (str) - end time of trace
    • start_time (str) - start time of trace
    • masks (list or numpy.ndarray) - masks for that trace, which is either a boolean array or a list of
      start/stop times in UTC
    • metric_name (str) - deadChanADFMetric string
    • snlcq (str) - station network location channel information for the specific trace
    Return type:

    list
